title: How to Kill the Emperor in Skyrim

steps.title: Start the “To Kill an Empire” quest.
steps.content: Start the “To Kill an Empire” quest. This is the third to last quest in the Dark Brotherhood side story. It comes right after the “A Recipe to Kill” quest where you are required to kill a chef named Balagog gro-Nolob. Astrid, the leader of the Dark Brotherhood will talk to you after you kill Balagog gro-Nolob and will give an item called “Jarrin Root,” which you will use to kill the Emperor.

steps.title: Head to Solitude.
steps.content: Head to Solitude. Solitude is one of the biggest cities in Skyrim. To find it, all you need to do is follow the road that leads northwest from the city of Morthal. Once you arrive in Solitude, head towards Castle Dour, the largest structure in the middle of the city.

steps.title: Talk to Commander Maro.
steps.content: Talk to Commander Maro. At the entrance of Castle Dour you will find a man standing guard. This is Commander Maro, one of the high-ranking officials of the Tamriel Empire. Talk to him and he will ask you to show the “Gourmet's Writ of Passage”, an item you got from the previous quest, “A Recipe to Kill”. After showing Commander Maro the writ, he will allow you to enter Castle Dour. The next scene will be inside the kitchen of the castle.

steps.title: Talk to Gianna.
steps.content: Talk to Gianna. Gianna is a chef in Castle Dour, and the one that will assist the main character (though not to be mistaken for an accomplice). Talk to her, but since you're supposed to be disguised as a gourmet chef, she will ask you to get the chef’s hat. This can be found on one of the shelves inside the kitchen.

steps.title: Get the chef’s hat.
steps.content: Get the chef’s hat. Look around the room and find a bookshelf nearby with a white chef’s hat in it. Approach the bookshelf and take the hat.

steps.title: Have another talk with Gianna.
steps.content: Have another talk with Gianna. After taking the chef’s hat, talk to Gianna. She will ask you what ingredients to add to the soup she is cooking. An option will appear on the screen allowing you to choose which items to give to Gianna. Choose the Jarrin Root which Astrid gave to you at the very start of the quest. The Jarrin Root is a very strong poison that can instantly kill anyone who eats it. After giving Gianna the root, she will prepare the dish and serve it to the emperor. Technically, you don't have to serve the Jarrin Root poison, but if you don't, you'll have to defeat the Emperor in combat instead.

steps.title: Follow Gianna to the dining room.
steps.content: Follow Gianna to the dining room. This is where the emperor is sitting and be prepared to escape. Once Gianna is about to place the dish on the table, crouch and slowly walk back to the kitchen. As soon as Gianna places the dish on the table, the emperor will start eating and immediately die. Do not wait for the emperor to drop dead, because if he dies while you are inside the dining room, the guards will immediately suspect the chefs and attack. Once you are back in the kitchen, escape through the back door and leave.
